title: Dextrust_Defi
author: Dextrust_Defi
created_time: May 13, 2022, 02:08:29 PMLast edit: May 15, 2022, 09:01:28 AM by Dextrust_Defi
content: The earlier information was incorrect. There was some miscommunication which has been sorted out. I can say Zac is fresh now.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: He wanted someone to work for him for free. Unfortunately you have fallen into that trap, now he has promised to pay you and wants to work on another project, but there is no guarantee that he will pay you. It exists in the midst of all the fraudsters, they are trying to find a way to get rid of you by making various excuses. Since this user is not in this forum, tagging is not possible. However, other members should read this thread and be careful.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: This is why the funds you are supposed to be paid at least for a month should be escrowed with a trusted escrow service that are readily available in the forum. Now you just did the work for the and got screwed.Try showing him the recordings of your responses as an admin of the group since he claims that you were never active.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: ScamViruS on May 13, 2022, 03:00:47 PMSince this user is not in this forum, tagging is not possible.Nor is it even necessary to create a scam accusation against him on this forum, since none of the alleged scamming took place here, and the person in question probably won't ever show up on bitcointalk--and if he does, it'll probably be under a different name if he's a serial scammer.  I get that OP is rightfully pissed off, but I'm not sure how useful this is even as a warning (unless it shows up on Google results or something).And OP, at least you didn't waste any more of your time with this jerkoff.  A month and a half is a fairly long time to sacrifice, but there have been members here who've worked for bounties on spec for longer (if I'm not mistaken) and were promised more than $800 that they never ended up getting.  Lesson learned for you, hopefully.  Get the money in advance or, as has been suggested, have it escrowed beforehand at least.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: Quote from: The Pharmacist on May 13, 2022, 11:05:50 PMNor is it even necessary to create a scam accusation against him on this forum, since none of the alleged scamming took place here, and the person in question probably won't ever show up on bitcointalk--and if he does, it'll probably be under a different name if he's a serial scammer.  I get that OP is rightfully pissed off, but I'm not sure how useful this is even as a warning (unless it shows up on Google results or something).Right, don't forget how anyone can easily change their social media username and deleted the whole chat (telegram), that's make the scammer account is like fresh newly created. This could be useful for anyone who wanted to invest on those projects he mentioned above, but I didn't find those projects on this forum, though it's already listed on coinmarketcap. This forum had bad SEO rank, so it's not easily to be appeared in the first result if you didn't specifically adding "bitcointalk" on the google search. It would be better if the @OP adding the word "scam" so anyone which search "First11 scam" "ETH Shiba scam" " ETH Floki scam" will may likely found this thread.
